code: @Manual{,   title = {minter: Meta-analysis of interactions},   author = {Facundo Decunta},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://fdecunta.github.io/minter/}, }

title: Meta-analysis of interactions
text: minter provdies helper functions conduct meta-analysis interactions using data 2x2 factorial experiments.

title: Meta-analysis of interactions
text: can install development version minter GitHub :

title: Meta-analysis of interactions
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(minter)  data(fake_data)  # Compute the effect sizes fake_data <- inter_effsize(   effsize = "lnrr",   colnames = c("Herb", "Fert"),   data = fake_data,   Ctrl_mean = C_mean,   Ctrl_sd = C_sd,   Ctrl_n = C_n,   A_mean = Herb_mean,   A_sd = Herb_sd,   A_n = Herb_n,   B_mean = Fert_mean,   B_sd = Fert_sd,   B_n = Fert_n,   AB_mean = HxF_mean,   AB_sd = HxF_sd,   AB_n = HxF_n )  summary(fake_data) #>     Study               C_mean            C_sd            C_n        #>  Length:9           Min.   : 8.198   Min.   :1.265   Min.   :20.00   #>  Class :character   1st Qu.: 8.744   1st Qu.:1.321   1st Qu.:23.00   #>  Mode  :character   Median : 9.022   Median :1.565   Median :25.00   #>                     Mean   : 9.518   Mean   :1.592   Mean   :24.67   #>                     3rd Qu.:10.413   3rd Qu.:1.902   3rd Qu.:27.00   #>                     Max.   :11.327   Max.   :1.986   Max.   :28.00   #>    Herb_mean        Herb_sd          Herb_n        Fert_mean      #>  Min.   :10.11   Min.   :1.058   Min.   :20.00   Min.   : 9.076   #>  1st Qu.:10.88   1st Qu.:1.428   1st Qu.:24.00   1st Qu.:10.155   #>  Median :12.90   Median :1.542   Median :27.00   Median :11.082   #>  Mean   :12.49   Mean   :1.522   Mean   :25.78   Mean   :11.032   #>  3rd Qu.:13.05   3rd Qu.:1.618   3rd Qu.:27.00   3rd Qu.:11.471   #>  Max.   :15.53   Max.   :1.916   Max.   :29.00   Max.   :13.889   #>     Fert_sd          Fert_n         HxF_mean         HxF_sd      #>  Min.   :1.006   Min.   :23.00   Min.   :10.80   Min.   :1.008   #>  1st Qu.:1.072   1st Qu.:26.00   1st Qu.:11.08   1st Qu.:1.390   #>  Median :1.503   Median :28.00   Median :12.94   Median :1.465   #>  Mean   :1.457   Mean   :27.67   Mean   :13.54   Mean   :1.421   #>  3rd Qu.:1.770   3rd Qu.:29.00   3rd Qu.:15.54   3rd Qu.:1.492   #>  Max.   :1.972   Max.   :30.00   Max.   :18.20   Max.   :1.713   #>      HxF_n       EffectSize_ID Herb_simple_lnRR Herb_simple_lnRR_var #>  Min.   :20.00   Min.   :1     Min.   :0.1283   Min.   :0.0009205    #>  1st Qu.:22.00   1st Qu.:3     1st Qu.:0.1446   1st Qu.:0.0016026    #>  Median :23.00   Median :5     Median :0.2515   Median :0.0019407    #>  Mean   :23.78   Mean Fert_simple_lnRR  Fert_simple_lnRR_var Herb_overall_lnRR Herb_overall_lnRR_var #>  Min.   :-0.2216   Min.   :0.0009554    Min.   :0.0334    Min.   :0.0004653     #>  1st Qu.: 0.1338   1st Qu.:0.0013764    1st Qu.:0.1615    1st Qu.:0.0006822     #>  Median : 0.1496   Median :0.0017009    Median :0.1987    Median :0.0007442     #>  Mean   : 0.1467   Mean   :0.0018761    Mean   :0.2313 Fert_overall_lnRR  Fert_overall_lnRR_var Herb_x_Fert_lnRR   #>  Min.   :-0.18431   Min.   :0.0005495     Min.   :-0.39215   #>  1st Qu.: 0.06604   1st Qu.:0.0006826     1st Qu.:-0.20258   #>  Median : 0.10348   Median :0.0007098     Median :-0.11527   #>  Mean   : 0.10676   Mean   :0.0007046     Mean   :-0.07350   #>  3rd Qu.: 0.16821   3rd Qu.:0.0007439     3rd Qu.: 0.06885   #>  Max.   : 0.39171 title: Compute interaction effect sizes — inter_effsize
code: inter_effsize(   effsize,   colnames,   Ctrl_mean,   Ctrl_sd,   Ctrl_n,   A_mean,   A_sd,   A_n,   B_mean,   B_sd,   B_n,   AB_mean,   AB_sd,   AB_n,   data )

title: Compute interaction effect sizes — inter_effsize
text: effsize Character. Effect‐size metric compute. Supported: "lnrr". colnames Character vector length 2 giving names use factors B Ctrl_mean, Ctrl_sd, Ctrl_n, A_mean,A_sd,A_n, B_mean,B_sd,B_n, AB_mean,AB_sd,AB_n Unquoted column names identifying group means, SDs, sample sizes control (Ctrl), single-factor treatments B, combined treatment AB. data data frame containing columns listed .

title: Compute interaction effect sizes — inter_effsize
text: original data effect size variance appended, named colnames.

title: Compute interaction effect sizes — inter_effsize
text: Facundo Decunta - fdecunta@agro.uba.ar

title: Compute interaction effect sizes — inter_effsize
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # This example won't be run during R CMD check result <- inter_effsize(   effsize   = "lnrr",   colnames  = c("yi", "vi"),   Ctrl_mean = ctrl_mean, Ctrl_sd = ctrl_sd, Ctrl_n = ctrl_n,   A_mean    = a_mean,    A_sd    = a_sd,    A_n    = a_n,   B_mean    = b_mean,    B_sd    = b_sd,    B_n    = b_n,   AB_mean   = ab_mean,   AB_sd   = ab_sd,   AB_n   = ab_n,   data      = df ) } # }

title: Log of response ratio for the 2x2 interactions — inter_effsize.lnRR
text: Ctrl_mean Mean outcome Control treatment Ctrl_sd Standard deviation control treatment Ctrl_n Sample size control streatment A_mean Mean outcome treatment A_sd Standard deviation treatment A_n Sample size treatment B_mean Mean outcome B treatment B_sd Standard deviation B treatment B_n Sample size B treatment AB_mean Mean outcome interaction AxB treatment AB_sd Standard deviation interaction AxB treatment AB_n Sample size interaction AxB treatment

title: Log of response ratio for the 2x2 interactions — inter_effsize.lnRR
text: Morris, W. F., Hufbauer, R. ., Agrawal, . ., Bever, J. D., Borowicz, V. ., Gilbert, G. S., ... & Vázquez, D. P. (2007). Direct interactive effects enemies mutualists plant performance: meta‐analysis. Ecology, 88(4), 1021-1029. https://doi.org/10.1890/06-0442 Lajeunesse, M. J. (2011). meta‐analysis response ratios studies correlated multi‐group designs. Ecology, 92(11), 2049-2055. https://doi.org/10.1890/11-0423.1 Macartney, E. L., Lagisz, M., & Nakagawa, S. (2022). relative benefits environmental enrichment learning memory greater stressed: meta-analysis interactions rodents. Neuroscience & Biobehavioral Reviews, 135, 104554. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neubiorev.2022.104554
